name: Sqreen
desc:
Mission ğŸš€

Sqreen's mission is to democratize security. We build the best application security products to protect our client's applications. We're making security accessible and understandable for everyoneâ€”eliminating fear and mystery.

As opposed to pattern-based approaches, Sqreen analyses in-app execution in real time to deliver more robust security without compromising performance. This empowers security owners to easily extend protection and visibility across their entire application portfolio without requiring on-going maintenance and tuning.

Values âœŠ

We donâ€™t think values are a few words on a wall: values are literally what we value, what we reward, tolerate and punish every day (to borrow from Netflix). We're a little bit obsessed about culture at Sqreen!

Getting startup culture right

  • â¤ï¸ Teamwork, humility, emotionally intelligence (EQ > IQ)
  • ğŸ™ŒğŸ½ All in this together: Sqreeners accomplish together, learn together, celebrate together.

Benefits/Perks ğŸ”

  • Premium health insurance
  • Generous leave allowance
  • Option to work fully remote
  • "Sqreenity": once per quarter, a one week period for employees deepen their knowledge of a certain topic or work on a passion project
  • "Brown Bag Lunches": inspiration session led once a month by a Sqreen employee or external person, usually on emerging tech topics
  • Equivalent benefits apply to all employees regardless of where they are based

Recruitment process ğŸ’¼

  1. 45 minute video call with our local Talent Partner
  2. 45 minute video call with the Hiring Manager
  3. Take home exercise, if applicable
  4. Virtual onsite with the team - 4 hours total
  5. Video call with Pierre, CEO of Sqreen
  6. Reference check

On average the whole process takes 2-3 weeks end to end, but we can run it in under a week if we need to ğŸ™‚!
fitIntro:
What we like about Sqreen ğŸ™ŒğŸ¿ ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ ğŸ™Œ

Sqreen believes that diversity is a journey of a thousand miles and not a destination. They are laying the foundations for a truly intersectional approach to diversity and inclusion in 2020. Some of those first steps have been drafting a Code of Conduct, which contains guidelines to create a respectful environment for all employees, and ensuring their work spaces (whether physical or or online) are inclusive, safe spaces for all. 

We love the fact that Sqreen views diversity as a long term strategy for success, rather than a marketing tool. They are currently looking for both long term high impact actions and quick wins to help cement diversity as a core part of Sqreen's DNA.

â€” Caroline & the 50inTech team
fitDesc:
"At Sqreen we want to build the best product possible, which means we need to ensure we have a team that draws upon as many different perspectives and experiences as possible. Diversity isn't the goal, it's the strategy." 

â€” Alison Eastaway, VP People

"We don't think it's enough to be not racist or not sexist, which is why Sqreen is anti-racist, anti-sexist and pro-actively inclusive." â€” excerpt from the Sqreen Code of Conduct

Here are the greatest gender diversity actions:

  • Code of Conduct: this document sets out in no certain terms how Sqreen defines diversity and inclusion in the workplace, and what is and isn't acceptable behaviour in this context. This starts by fostering an environment where micro-aggressions are eliminated through small but significant actions, such as the intentional use of pronouns
  • No degrees required at Sqreen, ever: job descriptions at Sqreen focus on what candidates can do, not on which school you attended
  • Inclusive bathroom project: all bathrooms in Sqreen offices provide a range of personal hygiene products free of charge for employees, visitors, candidates including sanitary products.
  • Remote-friendly working policies and autonomous, results-driven working culture (100% remote possible) and equivalent benefits & perks across 15 locations worldwide
  • Monthly meetings with c-level and product engineering management leaders to take concrete actions to take diversity to the next level
  • Selective partnerships to leverage the power of combined efforts to improve diversity and inclusion at all stages and levels of the organisation
  • Employees can explore a topic of their choice on work time for one week every quarter

"At Sqreen we want to build the best product possible, which means we need to ensure we have a team that draws upon as many different perspectives and experiences as possible. Diversity isn't the goal, it's the strategy." 

â€” Alison Eastaway, VP People

"We don't think it's enough to be not racist or not sexist, which is why Sqreen is anti-racist, anti-sexist and pro-actively inclusive." â€” excerpt from the Sqreen Code of Conduct
recruitment:
1. 45 minute video call with our local Talent Partner

values:
We donâ€™t think values are a few words on a wall: values are literally what we value, what we reward, tolerate and punish every day (to borrow from Netflix). We're a little bit obsessed about culture at Sqreen!

Getting startup culture right

  • â¤ï¸ Teamwork, humility, emotionally intelligence (EQ > IQ)

weLike:
Sqreen believes that diversity is a journey of a thousand miles and not a destination. They are laying the foundations for a truly intersectional approach to diversity and inclusion in 2020. Some of those first steps have been drafting a Code of Conduct, which contains guidelines to create a respectful environment for all employees, and ensuring their work spaces (whether physical or or online) are inclusive, safe spaces for all. 

We love the fact that Sqreen views diversity as a long term strategy for success, rather than a marketing tool. They are currently looking for both long term high impact actions and quick wins to help cement diversity as a core part of Sqreen's DNA.

â€” Caroline & the 50inTech team

name: Dataiku
desc:
Mission ğŸš€

Dataiku builds the future of working with data and artificial intelligence, by democratizing the access to these technologies through software. Dataiku has the vision that most organizations of the world - small businesses, large enterprise, nonprofits - will leverage those technologies and that most digital workers will be able to do more with data on a daily basis.

Values âœŠ

  • Diversity of people and perspective : we mix people and perspectives to shape the future of data & AI in a responsible way.
  • Tolerance & open-mindedness : we embrace differences and new ideas and fight against racism and bias.
  • Accountable camaraderie : we think, act, and celebrate as a team, trusting and supporting each other regardless of function.
  • Work-Life balance : we respect each personâ€™s way of finding balance, providing flexibility, and counting progress, not hours.
  • Dedication To Learning : we geek out with new technologies, learn from others everyday, and grow ourselves by growing others.
  • Conscious Long-term Responsibility : we strive to maximize our positive impact on the world. Through our products and beyond, for today and tomorrow.

Benefits/Perks ğŸ”

  • Shared experiences: We love to gather Dataikers and organize social events (remote or in person) throughout the year: daily catered breakfast or lunch (depending on local traditions), trivia nights, sports classes, monthly happy hours, quarterly regional outings, and an annual offsite create many fun opportunities to connect in an informal way with coworkers.
  • Learning for all: People at Dataiku are curious and avid learners. Thatâ€™s why besides our very complete onboarding week, we have ongoing learning opportunities like our Friday Universities, our internal podcast, our various Sales & Tech enablement workshops as well as free English/French lessons.
  • Parental benefits: We offer 60 days of fully-paid leave for all new parents regardless of gender or status globally as well as the flexibility for each of them to choose whenever they prefer taking that time off (all at once or not, in the weeks leading up to the event, and up through six months after).
  • Volunteer time-off with Ikig.AI: We believe everybody at Dataiku should have the opportunity to work on projects they cherish and where they feel useful. Our Ikig.AI program, allows each employee to accrue a global pool of Paid Volunteering Time with 2.5 days a year. Each of them can then use some of this time to work pro-bono for a non-profit of their choosing, up to 15 days every year.

Recruitment process ğŸ’¼

  • Interview with a recruiter
  • Interview with a manager
  • Assessment (technical test at home, roleplay or business case, depending on the role)
  • Final interviews: interview with a Director/VP + peer interview

Supported communities ğŸ¤

  • Black Lives Matter
  • Out in Tech
  • The Ocean Cleanup
  • AI Lab for good
  • Action Against Hunger

...and many more!
fitIntro:
What we like about Dataiku ğŸ™ŒğŸ¿ ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ ğŸ™Œ

Dataiku takes the Diversity & Inclusion topic very seriously but itâ€™s only a small piece of the puzzle they want to create. Dataiku really strives to build a community of people beyond their job title with some intrinsic qualities such as benevolence and respect. They have recently been auditing the way they hire and promote to better increase the diversity of the organization, working towards removing any potential conscious or unconscious discrimination. Dataiku also named a Diversity Equity Inclusion Manager leading various diversity actions with employees such as non-discriminatory training, partnerships with Historically Black Colleges and Universities in the US, and employee resource groups.

â€” Caroline & the 50inTech team
fitDesc:
At Dataiku, weâ€™re committed to shaping the future of data & AI in a way that is fair and diverse. As part of this general commitment to D&I, we believe we have a responsibility to not only support more women in finding meaningful work in tech but also to build supportive and inclusive environments so once hired, they can feel mentored and supported so they will choose to stay."

â€” Jerneeka Sams, Diversity Equity Inclusion Manager

Here are the greatest gender diversity actions:

  • Dataiku's Women in Leadership program provides female Dataikers with coaching and mentoring opportunities (with PILOT), support groups as well as Live and Learn Sessions around imposter syndrome, work-life balance, or vulnerability at work.
  • The Dataiku Scholarship for Women Leaders in data science helps foreign female students join Essec & CentraleSupelec's elite program in Data Sciences and Business Analytics.
  • The Diversity Equity & Inclusion Advisory Council is an employee-led group working closely with the leadership team on all global diversity initiatives.
  • All Dataiku managers will soon be trained on how to eliminate unconscious bias.
  • Dataiku partners with many organizations to foster diversity in tech such as Simplon in their Scale Women in IT Pledge, Girls in Tech and Qorporate.

Diversity and inclusion ambitions/goals for the next year

  • All Dataiku managers will soon be trained on how to eliminate unconscious bias in hiring and performance reviews. We will also be rolling out more leadership training around topics like mental health, inclusive leadership, and managing a diverse team.
  • Further development of our Employee Resource Groups (ERGâ€™s), and letting them be advisors as well as rolling out more workshops and activities.
  • We have several WIDS (women in data science) ambassadors who will be hosting events in Spring in two of our office locations.
  • Recognizing the work of our cultural ambassadors who help to drive culture and inclusion at Dataiku.

  • Read our most recent Diversity, Equity and Inclusion report for more info.

Our goal together

Weâ€™ve set ambitious diversity hiring goals to reach by the end of 2024: 40% of female representation 

  • 2018 - 26%
  • 2019 - 29%
  • 2022 - 38%
  • Women in People Management 31%

Our year at 50inTech

In 2021, 40% of our hires were women.

Dataiku offers a solution for â€œEveryday AIâ€, that can be used by everyone from technical to no-code. The design, deployment and management of AI is all encompassed within one central platform, improving the decision-making capabilities of teams using advanced data analytics. Amongst many diversity, equity and inclusion actions, Dataiku has implemented a  Women in Leadership program for women Dataikers, providing coaching and mentoring. Furthermore, in support of women's education in STEM, and to promote diversity within Tech, they have partnered with ESSEC and CentraleSupelec to offer the Dataiku Scholarship for Women Leaders in Data Science. This along with their leadership training, Employee Resource Groups (ERGâ€™s), upcoming Women in Data Science events, and other ambitions and initiatives, clearly shows their commitment to breaking down barriers to inclusion in Tech, and empowering people. It comes as no surprise that Dataiku has deservedly acquired several accolades over the past year including, Forbes America's Best Startup Employers 2021, Inc. 2021 Best Workplaces and Glassdoor Best Tech Companies For Remote Jobs In 2021. With ambitions to have a 40% representation of women by 2024, Dataiku is rapidly nearing achieving their goal, and weâ€™re excited to join and support them on this journey, and beyond.

â€” Caroline & the 50inTech team

name: Zenly
desc:
Mission ğŸš€

Zenly is a passionate team working to create genuine connections between people and their loved ones, by offering an alternative to products that were meant to connect us but only alienated us.

Values âœŠ

We can definitely say that â€œambition & passionâ€; â€œethicsâ€ and â€œdetail-orientedâ€ to better serve our users - can describe us at this stage :)

  • Ambition & Passion: It's what fuels the team to constantly improve and to build the best product in the market for our users
  • Ethics: Proud of taking care of people in the right way, from our user data to our employee well-being
  • Details oriented: What may seem like small details are actually the seeds for bigger achievements ğŸš€

Benefits/Perks ğŸ”

Zenly wants to make everyone as comfortable as possible in a spacious, fun, and light-filled office in the Bastille area of Paris.

Hereâ€™s an overview of what an offer at Zenly comes with:

Compensation:

  • Competitive compensation, including RSUs for every permanent employee (this means free Snap shares)
  • Relocation and visa procedures support for internationals. Zenly covers all expenses from visa procedures, packing and delivery services, corporate housing, administrative help.
  • Allowance boost: in addition to your base salary, we offer a monthly international phone allowance (â‚¬95), a monthly well-being allowance (â‚¬75), and a monthly lunch allowance (â‚¬352)
  • 100% reimbursement of your public transportation subscription
  • Vacation: between 30 and 35 paid days off per year

Health & Wellness:

  • 100% coverage of your health insurance for you and your partner
  • In addition to the best healthcare system in the world, we offer additional medical, dental and optical insurance for you and your family
  • Weekly yoga and meditation classes (in the office or via Zoom)
  • Parental leave: between 16 and 26 weeks for new parents (including the case of an adoption)
  • Nursery/Day Care support. For a smooth transition upon returning to work after your parental leave, weâ€™ve partnered with a nursery/day care organisation to ensure a spot for Zenly parents during the year

Learning:

  • Everything you need to grow in your role and accelerate your learning and development: from the millions of books in our office, to online courses, to coaching. The list is always growing and you can help shape it.
  • Language classes (Japanese, French, and English)

Office:

  • Rest and fun areas: chill zone, ping pong table, climbing wall, green atrium, LOTS of natural light
  • Pet-friendly office ğŸ•
  • Free drinks and snacks of all kinds (homemade pastry, bread, fruit, etc.) everyday :)

Fun: regular drinks, and trips abroad every year with the whole team (French Alps, Sicily, Majorca, Marrakesh)

Recruitment process ğŸ’¼

Our general framework is the following, subject to flexibility sometimes:

  • Step 1: Call/Meeting with a Recruitment Team Member
  • Step 2: Call/Meeting with the Hiring Manager
  • Step 3: Skillset evaluation: assessments for engineers OR portfolio presentation for designers following a debrief with future colleagues and discussions with cross-functional team-members
  • Step 4: Discussion with a Leadership Member

Supported communities ğŸ¤

  • WomenHack
  • TechLadies
  • WomenTech Network
  • WiMLDS (Women in Machine Learning & Data Science)
  • Coding gouter with kids
  • ESAT: an organization employing disabled workers
  • Kindness day: at least once a year Zenly dedicates a day to give back to local communities (distribution of hot meals for homeless people, cleaning the forest, and a lot more!)
fitIntro:
What we like about Zenly ğŸ™ŒğŸ¿ ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ ğŸ™Œ

Diversity is inherent to Zenly. Building with a diverse team is the only way to build a product that truly serves their diverse audience of millions of people around the world. In short: Zenly needs to be as diverse as its own users. As a team, Zenly is more focused on doing the right thing for their employees, rather than just communicating about it. They are detail-oriented: making incremental improvements at every level of the organisation is what leads to the bigger achievements. Diversity also means having different perspectives and mindsets within the team, to create a dynamic environment, fostering innovation and creativity, which ultimately enables them to build a product that people want to use.

â€” Caroline & the 50inTech team
fitDesc:
"Building diversity within our team is just as much of a priority at Zenly as building new features."

â€” Claire Pluvinage, Head of HR and Operations

Here are the greatest gender diversity actions:

  • Parental Act: Zenly granted 1 month of paid leave for any 2nd parent since 2017, even before the Parental Act recommended it
  • Family leave: In 2020, they went further by allowing 16 weeks of paid leave for any 2nd parent, regardless of gender, including the case of an adoption. They also extended the maternity leave to 26 weeks!

*Details here:

  1. Maternity leave: 26 weeks fully covered (with a minimum of 6 weeks before and 10 weeks after the babyâ€™s birth)
  2. Second parent leave: 16 weeks fully covered for everyone with more than 4 months of seniority in the company
  3. Adoption leave: 16 weeks fully covered for everyone with more than 4 months of seniority in the company*
  • Equal Pay and fair opportunities. Grid-compensation and grid-evaluations systems to make sure everyone is considered fairly according to their skills. Transparent and candid discussions throughout the year between team members, managers and HR with the opportunity to speak up
  • Internal & informal group discussions and meetups around diversity and inclusion: WomenCrew, The International Group, Living in Paris
  • 3rd participation in WomenHack events to recruit more women in Tech
  • Host of diversity-oriented groups: Women in Machine Learning & Data Science presentation, Coding GoÃ»ter where parents and kids, regardless of gender, play with programming and tech tools
  • Contribution to the report Diversity and inclusion among Start-ups produced by Firstalent
  • Corporate gifts and accessories produced by ESAT (an organization employing disabled workers) whenever possible

name: Vestiaire Collective
desc:
Mission ğŸš€

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global app for desirable pre-loved fashion.

It is dedicated to transforming the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by promoting the circular fashion movement as an alternative to overconsumption and the wasteful practices of the fast fashion industry. It provides its fashion activist community with inspiration, tools and features to lead the change as they sell and buy unique pre-loved pieces from each other's wardrobes. The platform is unique thanks to its highly engaged activist community and its rare, desirable inventory of over 2 million items that includes 120,000 new listings every week.

Launched in Paris in 2009, Vestiaire Collective has offices in Paris, New York and Hong Kong and a tech hub in Berlin. Find out more by downloading the app, visiting vestiairecollective.com and following @vestiaireco on Instagram.

Benefits/Perks ğŸ”

  • Learning & Development: the company encourages managers to open up their personal and professional networks to employees in order to promote personal development and career advancement.
  • Opportunity For All: Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunity employer, and actively works to create an inclusive and supportive work culture to allow all employees to feel they belong and are valued.

Recruitment process ğŸ’¼

  • First call with a Talent Team member
  • Interviews with manager and team
  • Interviews with board members **

Supported communities ğŸ¤

  • Womenâ€™s Empowerment: Our Womenâ€™s Empowerment project team aims to promote gender equality at Vestiaire Collective and help women advance through the company to leadership positions. Weâ€™re focused on increasing the number of women working in data, product and tech roles, and on adapting our recruitment process to help reach women with the skills we need.
  • Disability: Disability issues can be really complicated, thatâ€™s why we have a Diversity project team committed to raising awareness around making sure that Vestiaire Collective is an accessible place to work. We help employees find flexible solutions to their specific needs within the company, and make sure that company policies are malleable around the different needs of the people we work with.
  • International Hires: There are people from over 40 different nationalities working in our offices in Paris, New York, Berlin, and Hong Kong. When we help a new hire relocate, itâ€™s about more than just helping to pay for moving costs or finding and paying for housing during a contractâ€™s trial period â€” we make an effort to make sure that employees coming to a new city, or country, are welcomed, trained, and integrated into our office family!
  • Sustainability: We recently hired a Chief Sustainability & Inclusion Officer. We know that the fashion industry generates significant waste, and we want to break the cycle and effect real change in consumer habits. Sustainability is more than a single Employee Resource Group at Vestiaire Collective, itâ€™s in the very DNA of our business!
fitIntro:
What we like about Vestiaire Collective ğŸ™ŒğŸ¿ ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ ğŸ™Œ

Vestiaire Collective is a business built around bringing greater sustainability to an industry whose strength lies in its diversity of styles, tastes, and looks. With 7 women members of the Board and women as 60% of its employees, Vestiaire Collective is focused on increasing the number of women working in its data and tech teams, as well as strengthening the diversity of its workforce as it expands to new countries. From ensuring equal pay for equal experience, to hiring a Chief Sustainability & Inclusion Officer, they are taking actions that match their rhetoric to ensure that their company is a welcoming, accessible place to build a career.

â€” Caroline & the 50inTech team
fitDesc:
"I am very proud to have such a diverse team with 60% of all staff, 50% of our Executive Team being woman, and with, of course, Fanny Moizant and Sophie Hersan as founders. However, this is not enough: in our tech team we only have 16% woman and we have kicked off a series of initiatives to change that:

  • Organize the recruitment process with the participation of diverse interviewees
  • Develop school partnerships
  • Planning a Tech Lab 2021 only for women
  • Develop partnerships with organizations/associations
  • Develop a partnership with 50inTech
  • Sponsor WomenHack
  • Increase our Referral Program for women We will also do a third-party assessment to get more transparency on other levels of diversity and have empowered our staff through a task force that will help us raise the bar!"

â€” Maximilian Bittner, CEO of Vestiaire Collective

Here are the greatest gender diversity actions:

  • There are several formal ERGs active at Vestiaire Collective, like â€œWomenâ€™s empowerment,â€ â€œEqual opportunities,â€ â€œDisablities,â€ and â€œLGBTQ+â€.
  • The company is committed to having women present during the recruitment process, especially for tech roles.
  • There is no pay gap between men and women with the same levels of experience at Vestiaire Collective.
  • Vestiaire Collective has hired a Chief Sustainability & Inclusion Officer to develop diversity and inclusion actions.

diversityActions:
Fair Career Path

  • The company is committed to having women present during the recruitment process, especially for tech roles.

Equal Pay

  • There is no pay gap between men and women with the same levels of experience at Vestiaire Collective.

DEI actions

  • Vestiaire Collective has a dedicated Chief Sustainability & Inclusion Officer to develop diversity and inclusion actions
  • There are several formal ERGs active at Vestiaire Collective, like â€œWomenâ€™s empowermentâ€, â€œAccessibility & Wellbeingâ€, â€œLGBTQIA+â€, â€œParents @ Vestiaireâ€ and â€œEthnic Diversityâ€
mission:
Started in 2009, Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Theyâ€™re dedicated to transforming the industry for a more sustainable future by promoting the circular fashion movement as an alternative to overproduction, overconsumption, and the wasteful practices/habits of the fashion sector.

They provide their massive community of 23 million members worldwide, with the best customer experience, from product discovery, buyer-seller interactions, and platform safety to delivery, thanks to their knowledgeable curation/authentication/quality control and tech teams (Data scientists, DevOps, Android Developersâ€¦)

They operate in 78 countries and offer an unparalleled catalog of 5 million luxury and desirable fashion items, with 6,000 brands available, including 20,000 products added daily.

Vestiaire Collective is 800 diverse employees strong, with 50+ nationalities, spread over 14 locations: Paris (HQ), Tourcoing, Berlin, Lisbon, London, Crawley, New York, Los Angeles, Hong Kong, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh City, Shanghai, Tokyo, and Seoul.
 

Find out more by downloading the app, visiting vestiairecollective.com, and following @vestiaireco on Instagram.
quote:
I am delighted to have such a diverse team. Regarding gender parity, 55% of all staff members and 40% of our Executive Team are women. We are also very proud to be one of the rare French unicorns being co-founded by two women, Fanny Moizant and Sophie Hersan.

However, this is not enough: only 26% of our talented Tech, Product, and Data team members are women. We have kicked off a series of initiatives to change that:

  • Organize the recruitment process with the participation of diverse interviewees.
  • Develop a partnership with 50inTech.
  • Plan a Tech Lab 2023 only for women.
  • Organize a Women's mentoring & coaching program.
  • Organize roundtable discussions to empower women.
  • Hold DEI @Vestiaire - Talks for Change sessions where inspiring women leaders share their experiences and career advice.
  • Increase our Referral Program for Women in Tech.

â€” Maximilian Bittner, CEO of Vestiaire Collective
recruitment:
Here's what you can expect when you apply for a role with us.

A Talent Acquisition Manager will give you a short screening call to kick off the process. It will be followed by:

1. A 60-min interview with a Talent Acquisition Manager.

2. A 60-min interview with a Hiring Manager (your future manager).

3. A business case / technical test and restitution with your future colleagues (peers).

4. Optional: a 30-minute interview with one of our Excom members (depending on your role).

5. A reference check.

6. An offer.
weLike:
Vestiaire Collective is a business built around bringing greater sustainability to an industry whose strength lies in its diversity of styles, tastes, and looks. With 6 women members of the Board and women as 55% of its employees, Vestiaire Collective is focused on increasing the number of women working in its data and tech teams, as well as strengthening the diversity of its workforce as it expands to new countries. From ensuring equal pay for equal experience, to hiring a Chief Sustainability & Inclusion Officer, they are taking actions that match their rhetoric to ensure that their company is a welcoming, accessible place to build a career.

â€” Caroline & the 50inTech team
values:
• Activism: We save the planet, our way.
  • Dedication: We work hard and do whatever it takes to win.
  • Greatness: We think big and never settle.
  • Transparency: We tell the truth no matter what.
  • Community: We play as one.

fitIntro:
What we like about... OCTO Technology ğŸ™ŒğŸ¿ ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ ğŸ™Œ

All too often, company values are just empty slogans. We love the fact that, at OCTO, the real objective is to create a space for each and every employee to grow. 

Since the company's creation in 1998, big steps have been taken, starting with the MoreWomen initiative aiming to include more women across the company. In 2017, OCTO broadened its definition of diversity to include age, ethnicity and sexuality. Every three weeks, community of practice come together to discuss the key diversity challenges. 

That way, the company's diversity efforts are shaped from the bottom up by the employees themselves, rather than HR or management

â€” Caroline & the 50inTech team
fitDesc:
Octo Technology's greatest diversity actions ğŸ¤

  • We are making a conscious effort to prevent gendered language and other forms of bias on our job postings and careers website.
  • We regularly drive actions for the promotion of technology in schools, in order to raise awareness and encourage girls, and underprivileged students more generally, to consider a career in tech, giving them an overview of different career paths and inviting them to visit OCTOâ€™s offices for workshops such as â€œhow to write a good CVâ€ or "how to work together in a team".
  • Ensure that prospective job applicants recognize that OCTO is a great place to grow.
desc:
Mission ğŸš€

OCTO is a tribe of tribes based on creativity, expertise, sharing and kindness. We are a community of passionate people who offer technological and methodological expertise for clients ranging from start-ups to multinationals.

We believe that IT is transforming companies. We know that major achievements are the result of knowledge sharing and pleasure derived from working together. We are constantly looking for the best way of doing things.

Initially founded in 1998 as the first IT architect firm, pioneer of agile delivery since 2004, nominated Great Place to work and talent cluster on several occasions, we joined Accenture Digital in 2016 to offer our clients a unique range of technological and sector-based expertise on the French market. Our differentiating factor is our culture and the way we do things. With OCTO, you will be choosing teams with strong beliefs and who are committed to the success of your projects. Since 1998, we have been helping our clients build IS and apps that have transformed their companies by working on several areas: technology, methodology and understanding business line challenges. By joining Accenture Digital, we offer clients an unparalleled range of technological and sector-based expertise on the French market.

We support our customers in their digital transformation through bespoke consulting services, auditing, and the implementation of concrete solutions. Since 1998, our technological and methodological expertise has earned the trust of clients ranging from start-ups to multinationals.

Values âœŠ

Each Octo contributes with its differences and creativity, to build a community of expertise based on sharing and kindness.

Benefits/Perks ğŸ”

We trust our employees by default

  • Flexibility (but not full remote)
  • State of the art office equipment
  • Great working environment: shared and private work spaces, office gym, kitchen, large dining area and terrace
  • Meal vouchers
  • End-of-year bonus based on collective team performance, because we have truly a culture of teamwork
  • 5 days of training per year
  • BBLs (Brown Bag Lunches): sharing moments between Octos (examples: AI & ethic, blockchain for dummies, Ukulele classes or feedbacks on experience such as traveling the world..)
  • Octo people can, beyond their consulting time, work in R&D, recruitment, diversity, environmental impact, or any project that can improve our company

Recruitment process ğŸ’¼

  • Qualification call with an HR
  • HR Interview to define the professional project and values
  • Interview with peers (with two octos who occupy a similar position as the candidate) and often accompanied by a case study or role-playing to validate the candidate's skills
  • Interview with a manager (except for juniors) to discuss the purpose and culture of the specific tribe the candidate will be joining
  • A presentation (only for very senior profiles)

Supported communities ğŸ¤

  • SocialBuilder
  • TechFugees
  • AdaTechSchool

fitDesc:
As a company working at a crossroads of Tech, Sports, and Esports, sectors known to be still largely male-dominated, we are well aware of the need to be proactive in providing job opportunities for women and minorities, as well as in creating an inclusive working environment 

- Emmanuelle Roger, CEO / Co-Founder

Here are the greatest gender diversity actions:

  • 40% of women &/or non-binary in the workforce
  • 50% of women in the development team
  • Proactive efforts and open mindset to hire more women & persons from diversities. Our founders have done substantive work to change the way we recruit, looking for more diverse profiles to join our team. We are also currently reviewing the way we describe our job offers when looking for new talents, and the criteria that matter when sourcing and interviewing applicants.
  • More focus on your ability to do the job and your personality than your school background
  • Friendly remote working policies and strong autonomous working culture
desc:
Mission ğŸš€

Incubated at STATION F, Immersiv.io is a startup working in the field of augmented reality. We are specialized in the field of sports, working on augmented reality solutions to enrich the fan experience during sports events.

We are convinced that augmented reality will completely change the way we watch sports events in the years to come and we plan to be one of the leading companies in this field. We work with major players of the industry such as the NHL, the Bundesliga, the UEFA, FC Bayern, OM, Roland Garros, the FFF, TF1, or France Televisions for instance.

Thanks to our in-depth knowledge of content creation with augmented reality, we have developed strong partnerships with the manufacturers of the latest smart glasses and we are one of the few companies recognized as an Official Magic Leap Creator and a Microsoft Mixed Reality Partner (on Hololens). Our team has now proven its expertise in terms of UX, design, and development on the main platforms in the field of augmented reality.

Values âœŠ

  • Innovation ğŸ’¡ We are at the forefront of digital innovation in sports and entertainment and are constantly challenging what already exists. We value creativity and research into new ideas and concepts, and are in a process of constant learning to remain forerunners in our areas of expertise.
  • Inclusion ğŸŒˆ We celebrate the diversity of talents which makes our team richer and stronger. We accept the differences of each individual and encourage open-mindedness at all levels in our team.
  • Team-Spirit ğŸ¤ Dialogue and collaboration are major principles in the way we work and carry out our projects. We are committed to maintaining a peaceful working environment within the team.
  • Excellence ğŸ… We value a high level of professional standards in each member of the team. We are united around common passions for sport, entertainment and technological innovation. This shared motivation is reflected in the energy and enthusiasm we put into all our projects.
  • Integrity âœ¨ The work environment allows everyone to express themselves freely, while constantly ensuring respect for others. We cultivate a constructive and trusting working relationship, promoting sincerity, humility and indulgence within the company.

Benefits/Perks ğŸ”

  • 50% of transport fees
  • Swile lunch card
  • Great health insurance (Alan)
  • Open to home office punctually
  • A team of sports fans that meets regularly to play matches!
  • Inspiring working environment at the heart of innovation at Station F (with access to many conferences, workshops and perks on restaurants, cinema, sports gym...)

Recruitment process ğŸ’¼

Interview with technical responsible and/or co-founder

Technical exercise if relevant

Fit interview with the other co-founder (and future teammates)

Supported communities ğŸ¤

Our company is a member of the WXR (the only venture firm at the intersection of the next wave of computing - AR/XR - and female founders), and is supporting Willa (the leading accelerator of diversity in innovation in France).

fitIntro:
What we like about... Conny ğŸ™ŒğŸ¿ ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ ğŸ™Œ

Have you ever rented a car and lost your deposit because of a tiny scratch? Or did your landlord refuse to return your deposit for no reason whatsoever? We've all experienced the frustration of being powerless in the face of these situations. All too often, taking legal action is too expensive and time-consuming to be worth it. CONNY is changing that, by helping consumers understand and claim their rights. And that's what we love about them: they're not just another app. CONNY is making sure everyone has equal access to justice. But make no mistake: CONNY is not an NGO, but a high-growth startup with a cutting edge tech platform. Last but not least, it has a highly diverse and international team that is passionate about the company's mission.
fitDesc:
Conny's greatest diversity actions ğŸ¤

  • Candidates are often interviewed by female team members to make sure there is a good fit in terms of open-mindedness and team culture
  • Perfect 50/50 male-female parity within the Tech team (developers, engineers)
  • Aims to start giving workshops in secondary schools in the Berlin area to encourage more young women to apply to tech positions
  • Code of Conduct ensures that team communication is respectful and empathic regardless of gender, origin, ethnicity or sexuality
desc:
Mission ğŸš€

We are united by the drive to enforce the rights of consumers. Every value claim, however small, should be able to find its way into the legal system. We want everyone to be able to make use of their rights as consumers â€” regardless of whether they can afford a lawyer and how high the value of the dispute is. Thatâ€™s why we have built a tech platform that makes enforcing a legal claim convenient, with no financial risk, and easy. Click & claim.

Values âœŠ

  • Equal access to justice
  • Respect for democracy and the rule of law

Benefits/Perks ğŸ”

  • Urbansport gym membership
  • Team getaways abroad
  • Flexible working hours
  • Flat rate beverages (all you can drink) and happy hours
  • Fruit basket
  • Highly international work environment, with possibility to work remotely
  • 14 months paid parental leave (conform with German law) for all parents
  • 24 days of annual leave

Recruitment process ğŸ’¼

Total application time: 4-5 hours over a one or two-week period.

1. CV review

The candidate sends their application and if the experience seems relevant for the position we move on to the next step.

2. Screening video-call - 45min-1h

The candidate meets an engineer from the team to briefly discuss their experience/skills and to make sure all expectations are aligned about what the role is about.

3.Interview onsite: (when possible) / or video-call - 3-4h

If on-site: all at once, if via video call could be two separate days.

Step 1: a technical interview with two engineers from the team: The goal isn't to ace questions, but to understand the candidate's areas of expertise. Sometimes we do peer programming to simulate the day-to-day reality of the job.

Step 2: Soft skill/culture fit/team interview working with two other engineers

4.Call with the CTO - 30min-1h

Discuss the expectations and answer all the candidate's questions to determine whether Conny is the right fit for them

4.1Call with the CEO/COO (for senior/lead roles only) - 30min-1h

Discuss the company vision, business, social impact, collaboration.

recruitment:
Total application time: 4-5 hours over a one or two-week period.

1. Initial HR Call/Meeting ~1h
Initial discussion to discuss the role and review experience

2. Interview Call/Meeting with the team ~2-4h 
Two sessions with two different interviewers on each. It's a great occasion to meet the team, ask your questions.
The sessions are around technical and non-technical skills.

3. Call/meeting with a senior/lead associate ~1h 
Discuss the company vision, business, social impact, collaboration.

In total, you'll meet 4 to 5 Conny's associates, which should give a good perspective of the work environment and give a fair assessment.

name: Deepomatic
mission: Deepomatic allows organizations to see and make sense of the physical world by analyzing information. It envisions a world where expertise is served into vision-based solutions. It automates business processes which empower people's work with greater problem-solving and decision-making tools.
values:
Deepomatic brought the team together to build a set of 5 values that define the company.

  • Responsibility: as an individual regarding one's performances but also as a company, by applying artificial intelligence following a code of Ethics in their business decisions
  • Kindness: allow a work atmosphere in which everyone can have a voice, where all ideas are listened and respected, where people are able to work together well
  • Impact: artificial intelligence can transform society. The goal is to create powerful tools, which have meaningful impacts in real life
  • Never settle: The company wants to keep pushing the status quo. They realized that every time a client brought up a challenge to them, they were able to solve it
  • Sat-sat: for "satisfaction, satisfaction". Deepomatic is obsessed by satisfying the client, making sure they are happy with the services provided
benefits:
• Healthcare: the supplemental medical insurance covering 100% of the costs is paid by Deepomatic
  • Christmas and summer parties (that's for the huge ones), Yearly seminar, Raclette party
  • Organic fruits, tea and coffee available for free
  • Gymlib free subscription
  • Ticket Restaurant
recruitment:
Step 1 : Selection of rÃ©sumÃ©s

Step 2 : Introduction call

Step 3 : Technical call

Step 4 : On-site interviews for half a day with the team members
communities:
• The company mentored a women entrepreneur from Madagascar and supported her in creating the company, e.g. by buying computers she needed. Deepomatic is also her biggest client and it makes sure that working conditions are good and it helps local communities.
  • Forbes contributor which allows the CEO to be vocal about AI challenges such as the under representation of women in tech
oneliner: Visual Automation Platform. We enable companies to set up Vision-based solutions to augment workers and customers.
diversityActions:
• Parental leave: Deepomatic signed the Parental Act and provides 4 weeks of paid leave for any 2nd parent, regardless of gender. The company also ensures there is no loss of revenue during the leave, and offers 20 additional days in the next 6 months.
  • Equal pay: Deepomatic developed a skill matrix so that year-end reviews can receive unbiased evualations and decides on pay raise on career growth fairly, based on performances. Women are actually slightly paid more than men in the company.
  • Paid day-offs for sick children : when the French law let parents have 3 extra days off for sick children, Deepomatic decided to pay them
  • Day-care support: Deepomatic works with Grandir, a network of 1,800 day-care centers in France, helping employees to find a place for their babies.
  • Code of Business Ethics: the company wants to achieve meaningful impact. It created a few guidelines for conducting business defining which projects they accept to work on or which industry they want to help
quote:
"It is easier to maintain a diverse team if it is a core focus early on" 

â€” Vincent Delaitre, Founder and CTO
weLike:
Deepomatic brings image recognition into solid business solutions. It can go from reducing waiting time in cafeterias with a faster cash-out to a better identification of car windscreen flaws, or in rejecting non-conforming waste in incinerators allowing to save fuel. Artificial intelligence can bring great power; it also bears great responsibility. Deepomatic can solve a lot of challenges but it doesn't mean they want to solve those against their values. It competes with GAFAs with the culture of a family.

â€” Caroline & the 50inTech team

name: Singulart
mission:
Founded in 2017, SINGULART is an online art gallery dedicated to helping artists brave the international barriers of the art market. For this, we can count on our amazing team! We are currently 130 employees of 24 different nationalities. Our challenge for tomorrow will be to recruit 200 people in 2022!

Recently, we announced our Series B of 60 million euros. This is the biggest fundraising in the history of the cultural world! We are very proud of what we have accomplished, but it also means that we have many challenges ahead of us, and to get there we need your help!

We work every day with one mission in mind: to make our artists shine internationally and to make our collectors fall in love with them!

Our signature? A world of creativity.
Our goal? To give back to the artists a major place in our society, to accompany the art lovers in their artistic discoveries to finally make the art market more transparent and open.
Why do we do this? Because we believe that contemporary art has an immense power to open minds, to embellish our interiors and our lives.

The values of diversity and equity have always been an integral part of our DNA and are the driving force behind our actions. Our employees are one of our greatest prides. Their development and fulfillment are at the heart of our concerns and we make sure that everyone can follow the path that is best suited to them.  

Alone we go faster, but together we go further. This is why tomorrow we will need you.
Join us to go further together in our mission: â€œEmpower artists!â€
values:
• Boldness
  • Trustworthy
  • Creativity
  • Empathy
benefits:

  • 50% discount on the price of the works sold on Singulart

  1. HR call (30min)
  2. 1st interview with your future Team Leader (1hr)
  3. Technical interview with one of our Lead Developer (1hr)
  4. Interview about the vision and Singulart with the Head of Engineering (30min)
  5. HR check references
  6. Hiring proposal

values:
If Indy was a person, their values would be printed on T-shirts as the following acronyms:

B - is for â€œbienveillanceâ€ or goodwill:

They do everything in their power to make sure their employees are happy and fulfilled at work.

T - is for transparency:

Their employees know all the ins and outs of whatâ€™s going on at Indy, from salaries to strategies. They donâ€™t keep secrets.

O - is for ownership:

They encourage our employees to take ownership of their work and for everyone to contribute equallyâ€¦ Seeing as everyone has shares, the company is everyoneâ€™s baby!
 

And, of course, the most important thing for them is to beâ€¦

H - is for humility:

No ego, they are all working together to go into the same direction.

A - is for attentiveness:

Taking care of one another and being attentive in our work is a fundamental part of what they do.

P - is for passion:

Theyâ€™re all passionate about something and believe thatâ€™s what drives them as humans, be it theatre or flower picking or juggling.

P - is for perfectionism:

They say the devil is in the details, so at Indy, they make sure to pay attention to details! They canâ€™t afford to make mistakes because self-employed are relying on them to sort their finances.

Y - is for Y factor:

Theyâ€™ve always advocated for gender diversity and make sure that inclusion is part of their recruitment process.
benefits:
Being HAPPY is a key value at Indy, so working here means weâ€™ve got a hefty handful of perksâ€¦

Here they are:

Office

  • Escape the hustle and bustle of Paris and relocateâ€¦ to Lyon!
  • Weâ€™ve got a huge office space with a terrace, great for throwing parties

Flexibility

Cut costs

  • You get 50% of your lunch vouchers paid for by us

recruitment:
At Indy, we believe that itâ€™s very important to get rid of recruitment biases. Thatâ€™s how we can start becoming more gender-inclusive in the tech industryâ€¦

Our recruitment process is as follows:

  • Job offer: When a new job offer opens, we set concrete and objective evaluation criteria that have to be specific and operational. This means the interviewer canâ€™t come up with subjective criteria after they meet a candidate. We also create score cards for potential candidates, without ever putting in gender as a factor.
  • Screening stage: There are two talent managers specialized in tech recruitment, one male and one female to minimise biases, but also to allow the candidate to be more at ease.
  • Interview: We have a set list of questions that we come up with before the interview, meaning the interviewer canâ€™t change their questions based on first impressions. This interview allows to the candidate to know more about Indy, company's culture and about the job.
  • Tech test: It's a home made test of 4 hours. The candidate can choose when we want to realize it. Candidate have a lot of freedom to realize it in order to be in the best conditions to succeed.
  • Tech brief: This interview allows to talk about the tech test of the candidate. It's also the opportunity to go deeper in the job and the tech
  • Reversed interview: This is the chance for candidates to interview us. They can come to Indy with a set of questions and put us in the hot seat, so that they feel theyâ€™ve had as much opportunity to grill us as we do!
  • C-Level interview: Interview with one or two founders to talk about the vision and the strategy of Indy.
oneliner: Our ambition : simplify the lives of millions of self-employed by automating their accounting.
diversityActions:
Fair Career Path

  • Indyâ€™s previous goal of having 50% men and 50% women in the team has been reached! Now they are aiming for gender parity in the Tech teams.
  • Executive committee: The executive committee at Indy is made up equally of men and women.

Equal Pay

  • Career grids are used to help guide and benchmark career progression as to promote equal pay and opportunities:
    • The salary grid is transparent and open to all employees, which holds to account any pay discrimination that could take place. They also make sure that everyone gets a salary raise every year, regardless of their job position or past experience.
    • They also created a competency grid indexed to the salary grid for salary to be aligned with skill upgrades

Work-life balance

  • Flexible work schedule structure: Indy makes sure that employees can work when they want. This means that parents can schedule the working hours that suit them, and having kids wonâ€™t get in the way of getting the job done.
    • Up to 3 days of homeworking (flexible days) per week.
    • Tech profiles have the possibility to do full remote.
  • Parents:
    • Parental leave: 1 and a half year before it was passed in government as the Parental Act, Indy gave 2nd parents one month off paid leave after the birth of a child. They go even further than what is required in the Parental act: the entire salary is guaranteed during this month regardless of the employee's annual salary.
    • Theyâ€™ve added extra allocated days off if your child is sick
    • Theyâ€™ve got a Slack channel for parents to exchange tips

DEI actions

  • To further support inclusion, they use inclusive language.
  • Workplace Gender Equality Index: They scored 94 out of 100! Itâ€™s calculated based on five indicators: pay gap, pay rise gap, promotion gap, pay rises on returning from maternity leave, and number of top earners whose gender is under-represented in that group.
  • Objective recruitment process: The recruitment team is half male and half female, allowing candidates to feel more at ease. Also, their recruitment process makes sure no manager can disqualify a candidate based on their subjective opinion of them. Basically, they found ways in which to avoid discrimination while recruiting!
quote:

- Baptiste Faure, Talent Manager at Indy

name: Sketchfab
mission:
Sketchfabâ€™s mission is to make 3D accessible.

With easier 3D creation and capture technologies and the digitization of many workflows, 3D content is booming. Increasing numbers of artists, brands, and organizations are seeking easy ways to publish, share, embed, host, display, and manage 3D assets while the growth of VR and AR drives the need for and production of 3D content.

Sketchfab is ideally positioned to address both of these trends, allowing creators and content owners to publish and manage 3D assets, and for people to view, find, and use those assets. It combines the key ingredients of a winner-takes-all content platform: the best 3D player, the most partner integrations, the largest network of creators, and the largest library of content.

Sketchfab's business model is based on three pillars:

  1. Monetizing the use of their platform, through a freemium model â€” see https://sketchfab.com/plans
  2. Monetizing their 3D technology for use by Enterprise clients â€” see https://sketchfab.com/enterprise

name: Meilisearch
mission: We want to create a best-in-class search experience for every website and application. And we want to democratize the search experience, by keeping our technology fully open-source.
values:
We've identified our values by talking with everyone inside the company, as we believe it's really about the values that we have, not the values that we aspire to have. Here is what we've come up with:

Commitment:

  • We are passionate about what we do, and maintain a healthy balance between work and passion.
  • We care about the project, we won't hesitate to go beyond our individual job scopes to make Meili a success.
  • We disagree & commit, we are all constructively opinionated.

Quality & simplicity:

  • We prefer quality over rapidity. Working in open-source means respecting certain standards. We would rather be rigorous than rapid.
  • We are pragmatic and aren't looking to reinvent the wheel. We believe aiming for perfection is counterproductive, and are ok with failure as long as it means failing forward.

Openness:

  • We want to give back to open source by offering a free, high quality solution in collaboration with our community
  • We find solutions together and highly value collaboration. We accept no one knows everything
  • We value diversity by giving space for individual initiative & welcoming different opinions

We pride ourselves to have a very selective recruitment process: yet, we will give you all the keys to perform at your best during our interviews. 

What you should be ready to present

  • key achievements in your past experiences: it should be factual and illustrated with data

  • how did your role evolve within your previous companies: did you get promoted, did you lead the team or learned to manage one, did you take on additional missionsâ€¦

In terms of steps, here's an overview of what you can expect:

  • 30 min videocall: to trigger the conversation around a possible collaboration. We want to know everything about your professional background and aspirations, and detail our job description so you know exactly what youâ€™re stepping into! Please donâ€™t review your CV, we already read it ;)

/ with your future manager
 

  • Hard skills evaluation: this is the step where we assess the jobâ€™s skills requirements with a case study (to prepare at home and present during a meeting) or a technical test. We will also send you online tests to review your English skills, or your management inclination for example

/ with your future manager and an internal stakeholder
 

  • Our famous Culture Fit Interview: you will get to meet your future co-workers! Ask them everything you need to know about team rituals, how do they work together, where do they get their external inspiration from, whatâ€™s their background and why did they choose to join Ornikar, how did they grow within the companyâ€¦

/ with your future coworkers and your N+2
 

  • If youâ€™re applying for a management position, we will have a specific meeting about it, to understand whatâ€™s your leadership style, how you choose your future team-members, how is it aligned with our managerial culture, etc. You will also need to provide references from former managers and/or team-members

/ with your N+2 or a member of the recruiting team

name: Cubyn
mission:
Cubyn is building the #1 e-commerce logistics network in Europe, disrupting the old-fashioned fulfilment industry thanks to its full-stack approach.

Leveraging its proprietary logistics networks (European warehouses) and software, Cubynâ€™s delivery & Fulfillment network is a growth enabler for all e-commerce players, providing them with the best quality of service and reliability, a unique experience for both e-merchants and recipients as well as fair and low prices.
values:
Ambition

Ambition is the will to achieve great things and reach the highest standards together. Ambition is the foundation of our growth and success.

Impact

In a time-constrained environment, we have no choice but to be demanding of ourselves and others to achieve success. To achieve our goals, we identify key challenges and allocate our resources effectively.

Ownership

Ownership is a core value at Cubyn: every employee knows that he or she has the trust and support of the rest of the company and moves forward with a mindset of empowerment and ownership, which implies the ability to be proactive and creative, as well as reliability and autonomy in daily tasks. Cubyn's approach involves constantly challenging the status quo and looking at things from a new perspective in order to build sustainable projects.

Leadership

At Cubyn, collective focus prevails over individual interests. Being part of a team allows everyone to grow through a strong sense of belonging, solidarity, responsibility, respect, transparency, knowledge, sharing and mutual challenge. Diversity and inclusion are essential aspects of Cubyn's culture.

Humility

In a time of success, humility means remembering the effort, perseverance and all the other values that got us here. Humility also means knowing that success can be temporary and that it can only be achieved repeatedly by being aware of the road ahead.
benefits:
At Cubyn, full-remote working has been implemented in 2020, with the possibility for all employees whose position allows it to work from anywhere in the world.

In order to facilitate team cohesion and allow each employee to have comfortable working conditions, Cubyn has an office in Paris within the WeWork coworking spaces and offers each employee an access badge to all WeWork offices worldwide.

Remote working is regulated by a Charter, which was put in place in November 2020 and includes for instance a biennial budget from Cubynâ€™s works council for each employee to purchase supplies and equipment to ensure a comfortable work environment from home.

Cubyn's works council is committed to improving the well-being of employees on a daily basis through social and cultural activities, including:

  • A partnership with Moka.care to take care of the well-being and mental health of all employees
  • A system of cross-team buddies to facilitate the onboarding and integration of new recruits into the team
  • Language training available to all thanks to GlobalExam
  • Afterworks on the many different rooftops of Paris thanks to WeWork + a monthly Aftercube (our homemade â€˜Cubyn afterworkâ€™ every last Thursday of the month)
  • Access to Leeto: a platform allowing employees to take advantage of benefits negotiated by Cubyn
  • Team building activities thanks to a partnership with Wecandoo (cooking workshop, oenology, escape game etc.) even during lockdowns to strengthen the links between coworkers even if they work remotely!
recruitment:
At Cubyn, criteria for advancement and promotion within the company are very clearly defined and transparently communicated to all employees, in order to avoid the emergence of bias:

  • The salary scale and internal promotion paths are public and transparent.
  • Salary raises are only made during the annual perf review, in order to avoid any gaps or bias.
  • Performance review and feedback meetings between the employee and the manager are held quarterly at Cubyn to ensure consistency and follow-up throughout the year.
  • Each recruitment process must include a female talent in order to fight the potential bias.
  • In tech teams in particular, where the recruitment of female talent is a real challenge, Cubyn places great emphasis on encouraging junior talent to apply with a view to training them and enabling them to reach more senior positions.
  • Cooptation bonus is doubled for any recruitment of female talent within Tech and Ops teams, where it is more difficult to achieve parity.

We also developed a partnership with the non-profit organization Social Builder to accompany and help women in their professional reconversion in the digital & tech sector.
oneliner: The shipping solution for scaling e-commerce
weLike: Cubyn is building the #1 e-commerce logistics network in Europe. It is disrupting the old-fashioned fulfilment industry thanks to its full-stack approach. Beyond this ambitious business goal, we love that Diversity and inclusion are embedded Cubynâ€™s culture. Since the launch of its Inâ€™Cub programme in 2020, the company has taken its diversity and inclusion efforts to the next level, including signing bonuses for recruiters who onboard female candidates, a parenthood charter, and even its own podcast on career progress. This year alone, Cubyn aims to Improve the proportion of female talent in hires, especially in Tech and Ops teams, to achieve a 50/50 ratio across the company. It has also committed to tripling the number of female talent in tech teams.
diversityActions:
• Implementation of a Diversity & Inclusion Charter.
  • Implementation of a Parenthood Charter, which includes for instance flexible working hours to allow parents to manage their schedules more smoothly.
  • Doubling of the co-optation bonus for female talent hires within the Tech and Ops teams.
  • Systematically including a female talent in each recruitment process to eliminate potential bias.
  • Launch of a podcast to highlight the career path and experience of Talents within Cubyn.
  • Meetings and talks organized with inspiring speakers on the subject of diversity in business and culture.
    The inclusion of â€˜diversityâ€™ in the company's values. 
     

In'Cub in detail :

The project was born in April 2020 on the will of Adrien Fernandez Baca - founder and CEO of Cubyn.

Inâ€™Cub is part of Cubyn CSE (works council) and has its own budget.

  • Goal : develop Cubynâ€™s visibility and attractiveness to female and international talent, and improve their well-being and professional development within the teams.
  • How to : identify and solve equity, diversity and inclusion issues or improvement areas, through cross-team and collective work.
  • How we work : The project is led by a voluntary team of employees in charge of coordination, communication and budget requests between the different hubs and sprints. Inâ€™Cub is composed of 3 hubs, each one being led by 2 hub leaders in charge of their roadmap (sprints, ETAs, special needs) :
    • Culture & Communication : improve Cubyn visibility and attractiveness both externally (candidates) and internally (hired talents)
    • Inspiration & Ethics : drive awareness about equity, diversity and inclusion issues through lunch talks and partnerships
    • Parenthood : enhance parenthood management within Cubyn for all teams and countries
       

Your D&I challenge for the year

Improve the proportion of female talent in hires, especially in Tech and Ops teams:

  • Achieve a 50/50 ratio across Cubyn
  • Triple the number of female talent in tech teams by the end of the year

Telecommuting has been a reality at Orange for a long time. An organization to set up with your manager. Orange favors "soft" transportation as an alternative to the car. And of course, we cover 50% of your public transport costs.

quote:
â€œOrange promotes diversity and inclusive management at all levels of the company, starting from the top. We are convinced that gender balance promotes better team performance, innovation and employee well-being. With the Hello Women program, we are actively seeking to recruit more women in our technical teams at Orange.â€ 

â€“ Delphine Pouponneau, Group Diversity and Inclusion Director
weLike:
As a leader in global telecommunications, Orange has been working on gender equality issues for over a decade. 

Since creating a Strategic Committee on Gender Equality in 2011 and signing the United Nations' Women's Empowerment Principles in 2015, Orange has consistently expanded and fine-tuned its Diversity & Inclusion strategy, as well as having it monitored and certified across 20 of its entities worldwide. 

In 2019, the company signed a global agreement with the UNI Global Union, a federation of international trade unions, on worklplace gender equality, combatting discrimination and violence, and work-life balance. And in 2020, the Group launched the Hello Women program, a comprehensive plan to attract and retain more female talent in tech positions. 

We love that Orange's goals for 2025 are both ambitious and attainable: to have 35% women in management across the Group (thereby matching the current share of women working in the company), 25% women in tech teams, and reducing any existing pay gaps to zero.
diversityActions:
Here are some of Orange's greatest diversity actions: 

  • Global agreement on workplace gender equality, combatting discrimination and violence, and work-life balance. Signed 17th July 2019 with the UNI Global Union, an international trade union federation, the agreement is now deployed in all countries where the Group operates.
  • Equal pay. In order to reach its objective of achieving like-for-like pay equality by 2025, Orange has a tool and methodology for pay gap analysis and action plans, including dedicated budgets, are implemented to reduce any gaps identified.
  • Hello Women program. To increase the numbers of women in our technical teams, we focus on raising awareness, recruiting, retraining and retaining women in technical teams through calls for projects, studies, and promotion of existing actions.
  • Regular studies and surveys to understand womenâ€™s experience at Orange and how to best retain them, improve their career opportunities, and improve their work-life balance.
  • "Shadowing" program. Orange invites schoolgirls to the office to meet women in tech and to show them what it means to be a female engineer or programmer.
  • International Charter for inclusive AI. Orange co-created this charter, signed by about 100 companies and associations, including 50inTech, and was the first company to receive the Gender Equality & Diversity For European & International Standard Artificial Intelligence (GEEIS-AI) certification, proof of our commitment to the use and development of inclusive AI. 
  • Company to be certified with the Gender Equality & Diversity For European & International Standard Artificial Intelligence (GEEIS-AI)
  • Certification, proof of our commitment to the use and development of inclusive AI.

    Orange's commitment to gender equality has been recognized repeatedly:
     
  • Orange was ranked 10th out of over 3 700 companies by Equileap (an international gender equality ranking), which makes it the 2nd best in Communication Services, and 3rd best French company.
  • Orange was awarded Global Top Employer for the 6th consecutive year in 2021 (Orange is the only telecommunications operator to be awarded Global Top Employer)
  • GEEIS (Gender Equality European and International Standard) certification obtained by 20 entities in 18 countries since 2011

name: France Digitale
mission:
France Digitaleâ€™s mission is to allow for Digital Champions to emerge in Europe.

Why? 

  • Because companies can no longer be solely driven by growth
  • Because Silicon Valley is no longer the center of the world and Europe can and must work together
  • Because the values of our startups and their positive social and environmental impact should attract talent from all over the world

How?

  • By creating a regulatory context (in particular, with public policymakers) that is favorable to the ecosystem
  • By helping our members raise funds, recruit, train their C-levels, meet with investors, improve their impact, and network with their peers


How to connect with France Digitale

  • Become a France Digitale member
  • Subscribe to the France Digitale newsletter
  • See our next events 
  • Get your ticket for FDDay
oneliner: France Digitale is the 1st organization of startups in Europe, which brings together nearly 1,800 startups and investors
diversityActions:
• A Board with a female majority, including women such as Sarah-Diane Eck, CEO of Surprise and co-founder of Sandblock, and Astrid Fockens, Partner andat IMPACT Partners
  • #Tech4Values
    An initiative that promotes an ethical and human approach to technology. It believes attracting the best of international talent to the European tech ecosystem is the fuel for shaping the worldâ€™s digital economy and having a positive environmental and social impact
  • Tech4Values Guide
    A guide in which 20 French tech champions share their best practices to combine economic performance with social and environmental responsibility. 
  • Talent Awards
    A unique, yearly ceremony to reward the teams behind the best scaling stories in the tech ecosystem. Open to independent startups or scaleups in France, members or nonmembers of France Digitale. Winners are rewarded for their impact in the following categories: Global, Diversity, For France, For Democracy, Governance, Branding, Community, Future of Work 
  • Talent Stories
    A series of interviews with the most emblematic scale-ups on the French tech landscape, to give an insiderâ€™s view and reveal what itâ€™s like behind the scenes
  • Scale-Up Fair 
    A three-day recruitment fair bringing together the best French startups and the best talent in the tech ecosystem. Running several  times a year, the goal is to attract the best profiles and support their growth within the startups in the France Digitale ecosystem
  • Talent Pool & Newsletter
    Going out to around 500 of the biggest France Digitale members, the weekly newsletter highlights two profiles per week from a continuous talent pool, giving talent great visibility 
  • France Digitale Day 
    A day of talks and events bringing together startup founders, investors, C-Level executives from all across Europe, to share inspiring stories and create unprecedented networking opportunities for bright talent looking for a career with purpose
quote:
â€œWomen in tech are just the first step, thereâ€™s a lot of work that remains to be done. We know we could go way further to make the ecosystem more diverse. Thatâ€™s why at France Digitale we continue to raise awareness.â€

â€“ Antoine Chauffrut, Head of Talent Programme at France Digitale

â€œI love that France Digitale wants to be so present on impact, and you can't do impact without looking at diversity and inclusion. My role there is to really advocate on the topic, and maybe if I can get the right tools, organise sessions where we can have role models, or experts in diversity recruitment talking to all these entrepreneurs so that they can take that on board.â€

â€“ Astrid Fockens, Partner at Impact Partner
weLike:
Europeâ€™s first network of startups and VCs, France Digitale is a vibrant community of people and organisations who deeply believe in the transformative power of tech. Led by a woman since September 2021, and with  more than 1,800 members, it is committed to bringing about a thriving ecosystem that inspires its components to pursue a positive social and environmental impact. France Digitale wants to play a part in shaping a meaningful world, and show that a sustainable vision of tech is possible. 

â€”Caroline & the 50InTech team

name: Didomi
mission: Didomi is an innovative French company that develops a SaaS platform for privacy management. We help our customers to comply with their regulatory obligations, in particular with the European Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), and to build a relationship of trust with their customers regarding personal data. Our solutions are designed to help data protection officers (CIOs, Data Protection Officers, Legal & Compliance officers) in their daily tasks regarding privacy management. We work with leading brands like Weight Watchers International, Orange, Le Bon Coin, Harrodsâ€¦
values:
• Kindness
  • Team spirit
  • Ambition
  • Confidence
  • Flexibility
benefits:
• Remote company
  • Remote equipment budget/coworking spaces
  • Stock options for all employees
  • Possibility to work from everywhere
  • Incentive salaries
  • Regular team buildings, offsite
recruitment:
• HR Screen
  • Interview with the hiring manager
  • Challenge interview about the code challenge
